content: rrriiibbbbbbeeeddd ssscccaaarrrfff a simple pattern which produces a scarf with loads of texture just 2 row repeat throughout the pattern so one to do in front of the tv or when not much concentration is required using the basic pattern you can make this scarf as long or as wide as you like i ve made mine long enough to wrap round the neck a couple of times a matching hat pattern is also available on ravelry yarn 150g james c brett marble 1 and a half balls or 150g or so of a dk yarn of your choice hook 6mm gauge 4 inches = 12 double_crochet and 7 5 row skill easy special stitches front post triple crochet and back post triple crochet lefties please go to the end of the pdf for explanation and pictures fptc 3 yarn over and draw loop back 1 working into a under post row of double crochet yarn over twice 4 yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook 2 insert hook twice yarn over and behind the post of draw through the next double_crochet from remaining 2 loops on right to left hook as you would a normal double_crochet rrriiibbbbbbeeeddd ssscccaaarrrfff bptc the back post triple crochet is worked in a very similar manner to the front post triple crochet in step 2 instead of inserting the hook behind the post take the hook to the back of your work and insert from right to left in front of the stitch and out to the back of your work again yarn over and pull back through and complete stitch as usual abbreviations chain chain double_crochet double_crochet fptc front post triple crochet bptc back post triple crochet scarf row 1 chain 20 turn row 2 chain 3 double_crochet into 5th chain from hook double_crochet into each chain across 20 sts row 3 chain 3 double_crochet into 2nd st of previous row * fptc round next st double_crochet into next 2 sts * repeat from * to * across finishing with the last double_crochet into the top of the turning chain of the previous row 20 st row 4 chain 3 double_crochet into 2nd st of previous row * bptc round next st double_crochet into next 2 sts * repeat from * to * across finishing with the last double_crochet into the top of the turning chain of the previous row 20 st repeat row 3 and 4 until scarf reaches your desired length the first photo shows the reverse side of the scarf the second photo shows the scarf with a matching hat the pattern for this is also available on ravelry rrriiibbbbbbeeeddd
